Package nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects

Class Asteroid

java.lang.Object
nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.GameObject
nl.rug.aoop.asteroids.model.gameobjects.Asteroid
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class Asteroid extends GameObject implements Serializable
An asteroid is the object which can be destroyed by bullets, but also will destroy a player's ship if the two collide. Each asteroid has a certain size, which determines its radius, as well as if any smaller asteroids spawn when that one is destroyed.
See Also:
Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Asteroid

      public Asteroid​(Point2D.Double location, Point2D.Double velocity, AsteroidSize size)
      Constructs a new asteroid at the specified location, with specified velocities in both X and Y direction and the specified radius.
      Parameters:
      location - the location in which to spawn an asteroid.
      velocity - The velocity of the asteroid.
      size - The size of the asteroid.

  • Method Details

    • getSuccessors

      public Collection<Asteroid> getSuccessors()
      Generates some asteroids that spawn as a result of the destruction of this asteroid. Some sizes of asteroids may not produce any successors because they're too small.
      Returns:
      A collection of the successors.

    • getDefaultStepsUntilCollisionPossible

      protected int getDefaultStepsUntilCollisionPossible()
      Specified by:
      getDefaultStepsUntilCollisionPossible in class GameObject
      Returns:
      The number of steps, or game ticks, for which this object is immune from collisions.
